description.narrative: The proposal is a follow-up to the "Protection" project which will end on 31 March 2021 and has been implemented in 10 French-speaking African countries. As part of this new project, it is planned to expand the Tournons La Page movement to three new coalitions: one in West Africa, one in Central Africa and one in the Great Lakes region. The main objective of the project is to promote, in these thirteen countries, the civic engagement of young people and women while fighting against the criminalisation ofpro-democracy activists and creating democratic space in Francophone Africa for new emerging figures. To this end, the action proposed by TLP has three complementary components. These are: (1) Supporting and amplifying in each of the coalitions the voicesof young people and women who are sidelined from the civic and democratic debate by the regimes in place. Most often, these groups are unaware of the very existence of their rights as citizens. To achieve this result, TLP will rely on its network of nearly250 organisations that share a common vision and have been raising awareness among young people and women for the past six years about the exercise of their civil and political rights; (2) Conducting advocacy campaigns, based on accurate documentation ofstate violations of fundamental freedoms of citizens, including freedom of expression, demonstration and assembly, in order to force governments to adopt reforms and/or enforce international standards. This advocacy, common to the 13 coalitions, both physical and digital, will be carried out at the regional (ECOWAS, ACHPR, etc.) and international (UN, EU, Department of States, etc.) levels. In the event of failure of the dialogue, it will include a judicial component through strategic lawsuits initiatedbefore constitutional courts and/or supranational jurisdictions. (3) Protecting endangered TLP activists. In the last 12months, no less than 55 TLP activists have been arbitrarily arrested. Protection actions must be maintained, both preventive (physicalanddigital security, security plans, counter-reports and campaigns to promote the voice of HRDs/activists) and reactive(legal and material assistance). This project is a continuation of the pilot project that provided protection for TLP-affiliated activists.In the context of the project’s target areas, it is impossible to encourage the voice of pro-democracy activists without guaranteeing their protection. Moreover, through the activities of the initial project, TLP has demonstrated that its advocacy campaigns have, through the visibility they bring to the movement,contributed to the protection of its members. Therefore, it is proposed to amplify this advocacy in the framework of the next project. By raising citizens' awareness of their rights, arousinganactive and wide-scale engagement of young people through innovative processes, including the use of new technologies, and ensuring the protection of activists, the change expected in the middle-to-long term in French-speaking Africa is ultimately democraticchange and the reopening of a civic and political space that is currently extremely limited.

participating-org.narrative: Agir Ensemble pour les Droits de l'

Established in 1992, Agir Ensemble pour les Droits de l Homme (AEDH) is a non-governmental civil society organisation committed to the defense of the rights and fundamental freedoms enshrined in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) and other founding texts, in particular the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights, the African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights, theEuropean Convention on Human Rights, the Inter-American Convention on Human Rights (Pact of San José), and the International Convention against Torture. Tournons La Page (TLP) is an international movement, composed of more than 250 African human rights organisations united in eight country coalitions (Burundi, Cameroon, Congo, Ivory Coast, Gabon, Niger, DRC and Chad) in coordiation with European allies. The movement aims to promote democratic alternation by non-violent means (advocacy, capacity building, defense of members, citizen mobilisation, among others). As a member of TLP, AEDH is the fiscal host for this project Protected and United for Democracy
